question: Who has been named as BBC overseas sports personality of the year 2017?
explanation: Roger Federer has been voted BBC overseas sports personality of the year for a record fourth time. Roger Federer is 36 years old. This season he has won two Grand Slam titles and ranked world number two behind his rival Rafael Nadal. Roger Federer previously won the award in 2004, 2006 and 2007. Muhammad Ali and Usain Bolt have each won it three times.
